intro: Cryptandra holostyla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Cryptandra holostyla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
